thread.title: Seven screaming children dragged to safety from frozen pond by model and skateboarding friend
thread.title_full: Seven screaming children dragged to safety from frozen pond by model and skateboarding friend

author: Rachel Bishop
title: Seven screaming children dragged to safety from frozen pond by model and skateboarding friend
text:
News Seven screaming children dragged to safety from frozen pond by model and skateboarding friend Ethan Turnbull and Bennett Jonas were skateboarding through New York's Central Park when they found the youngsters desperately trying to escape the water Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Brave model saves seven drowning children from a frozen pond Share this video   
An Australian model and his friend dragged seven children from a freezing pond after they plunged through the ice while taking a selfie . 
Ethan Turnbull and Bennett Jonas were skateboarding through New York's Central Park when they found the screaming youngsters desperately trying to escape the water. 
Mr Turnbull said the children - aged between 10 and 16 - were "screaming for help, being pulled down by each other, soaking backpacks and huge jackets." 
The 24-year-old's pal, Mr Jonas, said he had to make a split decision to either "get in the middle of that or watch them drown." 
But as Mr Jonas 23, leapt into the water, two terrified kids jumped on top of him. 
He wrote on Instagram: "I had to pick them both up and throw them to Ethan. I then grabbed a ladder and pulled the next two in. 
"Behind them were two lifeless bodies that I knew I couldn't get to. Seven children who fell through ice into a frozen pond (Photo: Storyful News/YouTube) Ethan Turnbull (pictured) and Bennett Jonas were skateboarding through New York's Central Park when they spotted the youngsters (Photo: ethanturnbull/intsagram) 
"I swam out and grabbed the last two guys and was able to get them to shore and keep them alive. 
Mr Turnbull told NY1 : "It was the last three or four stragglers, I mean the last kid at the end he was unconscious ... It was lucky for the last kids, the first ones – they were okay. Read More Brit trying to become oldest man to row the Atlantic is rescued in dramatic footage after boat capsizes 
Mr Jonas added: "The last one I didn't think I was going to be able to get to, the only thing you could see was the back zipper of his backpack. 
"He was gone. And I grabbed the backpack not knowing if there was a body ... I didn't know if he was alive or not." 
The children were all treated for hypothermia, with at least one hospitalised, after their ordeal in Manhattan on Monday night. They found the screaming youngsters desperately trying to escape the water (Photo: Storyful News/YouTube) Mr Turnbull said: "It was the last three or four stragglers, I mean the last kid at the end he was unconscious ... It was lucky for the last kids, the first ones – they were okay" (Photo: ethanturnbull/instagram) 
Tourists Lourdes Cuevas and her daughter Maia Ramirez, 15, filmed the moment the children went into the water. 
Mrs Cuevas, from Paraguay, told NBCNewYork : "At the beginning, they were throwing rocks, testing the ice, and then decided to step on it." 
Ramirez, 15, added: "They were breaking the ice. Some were like, 'No it’s dangerous' and [others] were like, 'No, let’s [walk on the ice].' 
"So after that they all got on together and said, 'Let’s take a selfie.' But when they all went together, it broke and they all went down." 
Fire Department New York (FDNY) said there was "no such thing as safe ice" The children were all treated for hypothermia, with at least one hospitalised, after their ordeal in Manhattan on Monday night (Photo: ethanturnbull/instagram) 
According to fire officials the deepest part of the pond was 18 feet and a nearby sign said, "Danger: Thin Ice Keep Off." 
FDNY wrote on Facebook: "Kids and adults should never walk on frozen water, regardless of the temperature outside. 
"Ponds and lakes in our city parks may seem frozen, but they are never solid enough for anyone to safely walk on. Read More Relive the craziest 24 hours in the life of roly poly Sutton United goalkeeper Wayne Shaw 
"By venturing out onto frozen water, you risk not only your life, but the lives of first responders." 
FDNY continued searching the pond for over an hour in case there were any other victims that hadn't been accounted for. Like us on Facebook
